init.description: Bermuda can currently see {device_count} bluetooth devices, reported across {scanner_count} bluetooth scanner devices. {status}

data.max_area_radius: Max radius in metres for simple AREA detection
data.max_velocity: Max Velocity in metres per second - ignore readings that imply movement away faster than this limit. 3m/s (10km/h) is good.
data.devtracker_nothome_timeout: Devtracker Timeout in seconds to consider a device as `Not Home`.
data.update_interval: Update Interval - How often (in seconds) to update sensor readings.
data.smoothing_samples: Smoothing Samples - how many samples to use for smoothing distance readings.
data.attenuation: Attenuation - Environment attenuation factor for distance calculation/calibration.
data.ref_power: Reference Power - Default rssi at 1 metre distance, for distance calibration.
data.configured_devices: Configured Devices - Select which Bluetooth devices or Beacons to track with Sensors.

data_description.max_area_radius: In the simple `AREA` feature, a device will be marked as being in the AREA of it's closest receiver, if inside this radius. If you set it small, devices will go to `unknown` between receivers, but if large devices will always appear as in their closest Area.
data_description.max_velocity: If a reading implies a device is moving away faster than this, we ignore that reading. Humans normally walk at 1.4m/s, if they're holding scissors they move at 3m/s.
data_description.devtracker_nothome_timeout: How quickly to mark device_tracker entities as `not_home` after we stop seeing advertisements. 30 to 300 seconds is probably good.
data_description.update_interval: Shortening distances will still trigger immediately, but increasing distances will be rate limited by this to reduce how much your database grows.
data_description.smoothing_samples: How many samples to average distance smoothing. Bigger numbers make for slower distance increases. Shortening distances are not affected. 10 or 20 seems good.
data_description.attenuation: After setting ref_power at 1 metre, adjust attenuation so that other distances read correctly - more or less.
data_description.ref_power: Put your most-common beacon 1 metre (3.28') away from your most-common proxy / scanner. Adjust ref_power until the distance sensor shows a lowest (not average) distance of 1 metre.

selectdevices.title: Select Devices
selectdevices.description: Choose which devices you wish to track. If no devices appear below, then Bermuda is not seeing any data coming from Bluetooth scanners. Ensure you have an esphome ble_proxy device, Shelly devices with bluetooth proxy configured or a local bluetooth adaptor.

global_calibration.title: Calibration 1: Global
global_calibration.description:
Choose your most common beacon and your most common scanner to use as a 'reference pair' to calibrate to each other and establish global defaults. 

{suffix}

data_description.save_and_close: After you are happy with the calibration, check this box and click Submit. Your changes will be saved, and you can proceed to the next calibration step. Leave this box un-checked while you adjust and test the settings.
data_description.attenuation: After adjusting the above settings for 1m distance readings, move the device further away (for example 5 metres) and adust the attenuation until the calculated distances match the physical distance between the scanner and device. Click submit to see the new distance estimations.
data_description.ref_power: To calibrate this setting, place the device 1 metre from the scanner, and adjust the value until the figures above reflect that 1m distance. Note that values will only recompute after clicking submit, and a more-negative number will result in a lower distance

scanner_calibration.title: Calibration 2: Per-Scanner
scanner_calibration.description:
This step is optional but useful if your scanners have different sensitivities or varying antenna performance. Adjust the offset rssi for each scanner until the calculated distance to the selected device is correct. It is best not to change the offset for the scanner you used as part of the "reference pair" in step 1.

{suffix}

data_description.scanner_info: Enter a non-zero number to offset the rssi reported by that scanner. Adjust until the estimated distance above matches the actual distance between that scanner and the selected transmitting device.

dump_devices.name: Dump Devices
dump_devices.description: Returns the internal data structure, optionally limited to the given address(es). Includes the rssi and other info from each scanner

addresses.name: Addresses
addresses.description: An optional space-separated list of MAC addresses to return info on. If blank get all addresses.

configured_devices.name: Configured Devices
configured_devices.description: Select to include only scanners and configured devices in the output.

redact.name: Redact
redact.description: Set to TRUE to ensure MAC addresses are redacted in output for privacy.
